title: Yetis on the Northern Line: how the secrets of the Tube inspired our darkest fantasies, from Dr Who to Temple
text:
As a maverick TV medic sets up a clinic in the Underground, Matthew Sweet traces the history of other subterranean occupants

This article has a good service on all lines. It will be calling at Hobbs End, where desiccated alien husks come screaming back to life; Museum, where Victorian cannibal troglodytes hunt for fresh meat, and Walford East, where Martin Fowler crashed his car just before Stacey’s mental health review. London Underground would also like to announce new facilities at Temple: a secret clinic where crims on the lam can have the bullets plucked from their spleens, no questions asked.

There’s the Tube – London’s subterranean train system, opened 1863 and still expanding. And there’s...
description: As a maverick TV medic sets up a clinic in the Underground, Matthew Sweet traces the history of other subterranean occupants
